poem:
Title: The Sun's Malice

Through intense storms and torrents,
God's wrath leaks from the skies,
Baptising wheat fields with ruin.
And we, remote in our purchasing,
Witness in the aisles the swell of scarcity,
The echo of a faceless dollar's disdain.
Thus we taste the sun's stolen fire,
Reaped, not in warmth, but in the cold platter 
Of dried bread, the hunger of loss.
